Before beginning to learn how to play, it's important to know a few basic terminologies involved with the game.These are some of the terms required to understand the basic flow of the game's conventions:
Hand - The amount of dice involved in each round of play. A traditional hand is comprised of 5 dice. There are also several different kinds of hands that can be identified by the face values of each dice.
Bet - A claim to the amount of dice and their face values made by a player during their turn.
Challenge - When a player denies that another player's bet is true.
The format of the game that Mobile Liar's Dice follows is Common Hand Liar's Dice. This means there is a single hand of dice in play during rounds and each player takes turns rolling the dice in the hand or betting on the number of dice with certain face values.
